text: another chapter in a landmark insider
trading case has been closed one of the
key figures in the Galleon Group case
Danielle Kaz was sentenced today in New
York a federal judge sentenced miss
Casey to 30 months in prison far short
of what prosecutors had asked for the 45
year old former consultant shared inside
information with hedge fund manager Raj
Rajaratnam earlier this year miss jay-z
pleaded guilty to three counts of
conspiracy to commit securities fraud
her lawyer argued for a light prison
term blaming miss Kay's these actions on
a 20 year love affair with a former los
about it this is not a pleasant day by
any means but it is at least over and
she now knows when she's going to report
to prison prosecutors had recommended 46
months in prison for Miss chiesi the
sentence is only part of her penalty
last week she agreed to pay a settlement
of five hundred and forty thousand
dollars to the Securities and Exchange
Commission the Galleon case is the
largest insider trading case in a
generation it's also one of the first in
which prosecutors relied on wiretaps to
investigate insider trading mr.
rajaratnam was found guilty in May on 14
counts of conspiracy and securities
fraud he faces sentencing at the end of
September this has been protests
reporting for DealBook at the new york
times
